Description: Blade, beekeeper's tool made of iron.
Curator's comments: Af1930,1105.11 to 20 are a series of Egyptian beekeeper's tools. For particulars see the donor's paper in the 'Société Royale Entomologique d'Egypte'. They are recorded as follows: 11. Khorab or Maftah made by a beekeeper of Mahalla tribe. 12. Khorab or Maftah used for opening bee hives, made by a beekeeper at Rahima near Bedrashain in Gaza. 13. Sadif, used for cutting away wax foundations. 14. Qassa fade, used to cut out queen bee cells. 15 and 16. Showkah, for removing individual cells, made for donor at Mahalla Kebir. 17. Makah, used for collecting swarms. 19. Libas
Acquisition name: Donated by: J E M Mellor
Acquisition notes: Af1930,1105.1 to 20 were given by J E M Mellor, who had collected them in Egypt where he worked from 1924-30. The registers records his notes on the find spots and usage of the objects.
